title: James Argent is 'BANNED from easyJet for two years'
text:
Reality TV stalwart James Argent has reportedly been banned from EasyJet for two years after running onto a runway while on holiday with Gemma Collins.

Argent, known as 'Arg' on the ITV2 series The Only Way Is Essex, was allegedly in deep water with Italian police after the he tried to access the runway through a fire door.

The 31-year-old, from Essex, arrived late to the airport, according to The Sun, and was reportedly told he wouldn't be able to board.

Argent, known as 'Arg' on the ITV2 series The Only Way Is Essex, was allegedly in deep water with Italian police after the he tried to access the runway through a fire door

A source said it was the 'beginning of the end' for the couple, who have had on-again off-again relationships since the show first aired in 2010.

'It was when he was partying hard, and even though they were meant to be on a couple's break it was a sign of things to come,' a source said.

'The latest drama is no surprise when you consider what happened earlier this year. Italian police were not impressed by his actions and neither were EasyJet.'

Meanwhile, Collins, who famously fell through a trap door while handing out a BBC Radio 1 Teen Award gong, was forced to call 999 out of concern for Argent's welfare.

Argent is said to be 'embarrassed' by the situation and told publications at the time: 'I wasn't speaking to a certain person so I didn't reply. They became concerned and called the police and ambulance.

'They turned up and checked on me. They came up to my room to make sure I was fine.

'I wasn't speaking to this person for a reason and they were worried about my safety because I wasn't answering the phone.'

'I was perfectly fine, we all had a chat and carried on the day with my parents, we were just hanging up pictures,' he added.

'The police and paramedics were only here for about 10 minutes. I'm slightly embarrassed really. I apologise for any wasted police time as I was absolutely fine.'

The Metropolitan Police added: 'Police were called at 13.11hrs to a residential address following concerns for the welfare of male occupant. Officers attended with LAS.
